arts.ttl: Runjaic: “If all goes well, Alexis Sanchez will be back by January”
arts.sum: Udinese manager Kosta Runjaic shared his thoughts ahead of Sunday’s match against Genoa in a recent press conference. The coach addressed various topics, including tactical considerations, player availability, and the team’s recent performances. Regarding the potential switch to a four-man defense, Runjaic remained coy: “Currently, I can’t tell you how we’ll play; we’re thinking about it a lot. We’ve tested this system in the last week, and it’s positive to be able to play with two formations. Both have their advantages and disadvantages, but the most important factor is giving 100% from the start.” On the possibility of playing Lucca The post Runjaic: “If all goes well, Alexis Sanchez will be back by January” appeared first on FootItalia.com.

arts.ttl: Udinese vs. Genoa opens the Sunday schedule
arts.sum: Genoa are the team who have scored the highest proportion of their Serie A goals this season in the second half of the matches (73% - 8/11). Udinese are the team who have scored the most headed goals in Serie A this season (6), including one in their last game against Empoli, and are one of only three sides yet to concede a headed goal along with Napoli and Atalanta.

arts.ttl: Serie A | Genoa v Udinese: Probable starting lineups
arts.sum: As Udinese and Genoa gear up for their upcoming Serie A encounter, both teams face significant absences that could shape the outcome of the match. Udinese will be without their defensive stalwart Jaka Bijol, who has been a constant presence in the starting lineup this season. The centre-back’s suspension due to accumulating five yellow cards comes as a blow to the team’s backline. On the attacking front, Udinese may have to do without Alexis Sanchez. Despite reports of the Chilean returning to training following a thigh injury, his participation in the weekend’s fixture remains doubtful. arts.ttl: Serie A | Udinese v Genoa: Match Prediction, Preview, Team News and Lineups
arts.sum: Udinese and Genoa will be looking for points when they clash in a crucial Serie A encounter at the Bluenergy Stadium on Sunday. Both teams enter the match with contrasting form and ambitions, making for an intriguing fixture. Udinese find themselves in a precarious position, having failed to secure a victory in their last four matches. Their recent form has been particularly concerning, with three losses and a draw in their previous four outings. arts.ttl: Genoa’s Vieira: “The team is focused ahead of the physical challenge against Udinese”
arts.sum: Genoa manager Patrick Vieira addressed the media in a press conference ahead of his team’s upcoming Serie A match against Udinese. The French coach expressed confidence in his squad’s preparation and acknowledged the challenge posed by their opponents. “It’s been a week where we’ve worked really well. I’ve seen a focused group,” Vieira stated. “We’ll face a physical and very organized team. We need to pay attention to the details of this match.” Reflecting on the team’s recent draw against Cagliari, Vieira highlighted some positives: “We created dangerous situations and scored two goals.
